newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS FRIDAY WEAKER ON KEY UNIT.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS FRIDAY WEAKER ON KEY UNIT.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar lost almost three cents to the key U.S. unit on Friday and foreign exchange dealers said the local unit could have slid further if the central bank had not intervened to smoothen its fall.
The dealers said import pressure and a lack of foreign exchange inflows had led to the dollar's depreciation.

"Today we saw the central bank coming in at around 11.3800 (on the U.S. dollar). It could have fallen to 11.4000 if they had not come in. They came in not necessarily to defend the currency but to smoothen the fall which I think was too sharp for them," one dealer said.
At Friday's close, the dollar was quoted at 11.3825/3925 on the U.S. currency from 11.3550/3650 late Thursday.
It slid to 18.9400/9685 on sterling from 18.8900/9200 but was unchanged on the mark at 6.5650/5725 and slightly firmer on the rand at 2.5195/5235.
